title: The Best Night Clubs In Lima
text:
(c)butforthesky.com 
When it comes to lively nightlife, Lima is a destination that offers a wide variety of different places to go, and clubs that play a range of different music. From traditional dance clubs to modern venues with several rooms, you will find plenty of options to fulfill whatever you want from your party night. 
The majority of the top clubs are to be found in the Barranco and Miraflores districts of the city, while there are also plenty of clubs that have a chill out space on a terrace. The entrance to the majority of clubs in Lima does keep a fairly strict dress code, so avoid the trainers and opt for the smart and stylish outfit for your night on the town. Nebula 
One of the long standing stalwarts of the Lima clubbing scene, Nebula tends to have a range of music from the 80s and 90s that will get people on their feet, and this usually means that the crowd here is a little more mature than at some of the other clubs in the city. International stars have played sets here including members of New Order and The Smiths, among others. The club really starts to warm up after midnight, so you may want to stay in the bars around the club until the night really gets going. Tequila Rock 
Located in the Miraflores district of the city, this club is well known as the place that is almost always open, both during the week as well as at the weekend. The dance music here is good, and in the busiest periods you will also find live shows here as well as the DJs spinning the tunes. The party here lasts as long as you want it to, with the club open until 9am every night. La Candelaria 
In the Barranco district, La Candelaria offers a more traditional Peruvian style of music, with live bands providing the dancing accompaniment in Creole and Peruvian folk music genres. This is a good place if you want to experience how the locals get down in their dance clubs, and you will also find there are some good Pisco Sour cocktails available, while the party here usually winds down after 3am. El Dragon 
If you are looking for varied and interesting live music and the chance to encounter some of the local bands that work the circuit in Lima , then this is a great club that provides a range of music genres and also has some of the most competitively priced drinks in town too. The bands on offer can range from funk, Latin and jazz through to electronica and traditional dance music, while the dress code here is a little more informal than in many of the city's other nightclubs. Dolce Vita 
At the heart of Miraflores, this venue has a lively atmosphere with big screens and disco balls sending the lights bouncing over the large dance floor, where you will find yourself moving to modern electronica and hip hop, with the occasional pop favorite thrown in for good measure. The crowd here is usually fairly young, in their mid twenties, and this is one of the places to be on Fridays and Saturdays, with the party usually drawing to a close around 4am. Aura 
This is one of the trendy super clubs in Lima, and boasts a large terrace with sea views that is one of the best chill out areas in any of the city's clubs. The club has several floors usually packed on the weekends, all moving to modern dance music, and this is definitely one of the venues where you'll want to be rocking your best clothes if you want to get in, as there is usually a long queue, especially later in the evening. Our Expert Recommends
